comments: Dunn (UTA) reaches in across DeRozan's (CHI) lower body, causing him to lose control of the ball out of bounds. Although possession was incorrectly given to CHI, there should have been a foul assessed to Dunn for the contact.
Dunn (UTA) reaches in for the ball and makes contact with DeRozan's (CHI) arms, which affects his layup attempt in the paint.

Dosunmu (CHI) turns his body as Sexton (UTA) changes the direction of his drive. As he does, Dosunmu's arm comes up and grazes Sexton's head during his dribble. Contact to an opponent's head/face can be deemed marginal when the result of a natural basketball move, provided the contact is not disproportionate or uncontrolled.
Sensabaugh (UTA) brings his hands to DeRozan's (CHI) side and marginal contact occurs as Sensabaugh releases away to retrieve the rebound.
Caruso (CHI) lowers his hand down and makes direct contact with the ball, dislodging it from Clarkson's (UTA) grasp prior to incidental arm contact occurring during the driving shot attempt.
Clarkson (UTA) and Dosunmu (CHI) come together at the same spot on the floor after the dislodge and incidental contact occurs.
Sensabaugh (UTA) is not in a legal defensive position in DeRozan's (CHI) path when body contact occurs that alters DeRozan's driving shot attempt.
Caruso (CHI) brings his hand to the ball and deflects it away from Clarkson (UTA) prior to incidental arm contact occurring.
Sensabaugh (UTA) slides away from Dosunmu (CHI) as his hands lightly brush Dosunmu, and the contact during the layup attempt is marginal.
Vucevic (CHI) brings his left hand out and makes direct contact with the ball, which dislodges it from Sexton's (UTA) grasp prior to incidental contact occurring.
Dosunmu (CHI) legally contests Clarkson's (UTA) jump shot attempt, and Clarkson loses his balance as he returns to the floor.
Sexton (UTA) and Caruso (CHI) engage as the shot is in the air, and marginal contact occurs as Sexton attempts to release toward the rebound.

Vucevic (CHI) rests his forearm on Collins' (UTA) back as they come together during the rebounding opportunity and the contact is marginal. Collins jumps into the air and incidental contact occurs between him and Caruso (CHI).
Caruso (CHI) commits a take foul on Sexton (UTA). The transition take foul rule does not apply to the last two minutes of either the fourth quarter or overtime.
Coach Fleming (CHI) is assessed an unsportsmanlike technical foul as a result of an altercation.
Craig (CHI) is assessed an unsportsmanlike technical foul for verbally taunting an opponent.
Sexton (UTA) commits a take foul on DeRozan (CHI).
Collins (UTA) is assessed an unsportsmanlike technical foul as a result of an altercation.
Dunn (UTA) does not inbound the ball within five seconds of receiving it from the game official.
Clarkson (UTA) extends both arms out into Dosunmu's (CHI) front and initiates contact to create space during the inbound.
Dosunmu (CHI) legally contests Clarkson's (UTA) jump shot, making "high-five" contact after the ball is released.
Sensabaugh's (UTA) arms come out slightly as he comes together with DeRozan (CHI) while the shot travels through the air, and the contact during the rebounding opportunity is marginal.
White's (CHI) left toe comes down onto the baseline while he is in control of the ball. Possession is properly awarded to Utah.
Collins (UTA) is firming up in Caruso's (CHI) path during the screen, and as contact occurs, both players briefly get tangled up.
White (CHI) legally contests Sexton's (UTA) jump shot attempt.
Vucevic (CHI) goes into the air as he pursues the rebound and marginal body contact occurs with Clarkson (UTA), who is also in the air during the rebounding opportunity.
